title: Reprise.2006.SWESUB.DVDRip.XviD-314rat272
description:
REPRIS ( REPRISE ) 2006 

REPRIS ar en film om vanskap, galenskap och kreativitet, om karlek och sorg, stora ambitioner och den ofta obehagliga kollisionen mellan unga forvantningar och verklighet.
Erik och Phillip ar bada arelystna forfattare, som vill skriva  den stora romanen om deras generation. Eriks roman blir ratad, men Phillips blir publicerad med stort mottagande. Men, Phillip far snart ett sammanbrott, delvis utlost av hans hangivna relation med sin flickvan, Kari. Nar Phillip atervander fran sex manader pa sjukhus forsoker han vinna tillbaka Kari, medan Erik fortfarande skriver med okande framgang.    
Filmen foljer Phillip, Erik och deras vanner med ett spannande filmiskt sprak som speglar kulturen hos ett gang typiska pojkar i 23-ars aldern. En film som ar full av kontraster i sin form och hos karaktarernas liv, Repris kan ses som en subtil reflektion pa ungdomen som en tid av loften, planer och forvantningar som gradvis upploses under inverkan av livserfarenhet.   

Filmen gar upp  pa biografer i USA den 16: maj. Vilket ar mycket ovanligt for en utlandsk film.
Biograferna brukar domineras av mindre an tjugo av de mest saljande amerikanska filmerna.

Joachim Trier ... regissor 
Joachim Trier... forfattare
Eskil Vogt ... forfattare

RECENTIONER:
Nu ar det antligen bevisat: norrmannen kan ocksa gor bra film.
Riktigt bra film. En oerhort drivet berattad norsk variant av
Jules & Jim. En bildbegavning, den dar Trier (bara avlagsen
slakt till Lars von Trier). Reprise har varit ute pa dvdmarknaden
ett tag men annu ej dykt upp i svensk pressning. Vi far halla till
godo med importdvd, med engelsk text. 
Fredrik Sahlin,SVT

This excellent film is as bright and mercurial as its protaginists. Catch it while you can. 
(The Times - 4 stars) 

The film is cockily confident with elegant exuberance. 
(The Observer) 

One of the most passionately and intellectually uninhibited works from a young director IÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ve seen in ages. Directed by Joachim Trier, who wrote the tender, funny, narratively ambitious screenplay with his fellow Norwegian Eskil Vogt, this galvanizing first feature traces the parallel adventures of two best friends whose twinned literary aspirations and everyday lives take the shape of a punk-rock bildungsroman. 
(New York Times) 

The film buzzes with snappy editing and a pounding garage rock soundtrack. Imagine Trainspotting with better furniture. 
(Independent on Sunday) 

A genuine pleasure. 
(The Daily Telegraph) 

An exhilarating debut that is funny, moving, intelligent and madly passionate. 
(London Lite - 4 stars) 

Hip, stylish account of two budding young novelists on the Oslo clubbing scene. A lovely, rueful tale of illusory dreams and inconsequential fame that zips by in an eye-blink. Form and content in perfect harmony. 
(The Guardian) 

Trier\&#039;s film is sharp, cool, stylised in its appearance but authentic in its content, a crafty little gem. 
(Film Four - 4 stars) 

The breezily ambitious Reprise blends the playful spirit of early Truffaut with a punk-rock sensibility. 
(Total Film) 

Reprise bubbles with talent. 
(First Post) 

A bright, thoughtful, showcase-y debut from young Norwegian director Joachim Trier. 

What makes it stand out ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ beside its natural performances and easy cinematic confidence ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ is the precocious and gently humorous self-awareness Trier displays in dealing with the threatening, underlying spirit of his generation: one of, as one character puts it, ÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ironic punk quietly evolved into cynical commercialismÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½. 
(Time Out) 

While it\&#039;s true that Trier is expert at evoking the dire seriousness of late youth, the film\&#039;s tone is as comic as it is tragic. 
(Scotland on Sunday - 4 stars) 

Reprise is essential. Literate without being pretentiously poetic, imaginative without losing focus and downright hip without being exclusive, it\&#039;s a film that will impact upon your soul with near immediacy 
(Tuned Magazine) 

With a breathless introduction full of exploratory narrative, flashbacks and fast forwards that impresses more than most directors manage with an entire canon of work, this is an amazing debut from Trier. The storyÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s ingenuity is matched by his creative visual flair and itÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½ÃƒÂ¯Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â½s also loaded with sharply ironic humour. Reprise is sublimely brilliant. 
(Clash Magazine) 

Jules et Jim for the current twenty-something generation 
(Europeanfilms.net) 

A bright, frenetic and agile debut 
(Screen International) 

Winner - Diesel Discovery Award 
(Toronto International Film Festival) 

Winner - Best Director 
Winner - Don Quijote Award 
(Karlovy Varly Festival) 

Impressive debut, redolent of early Truffaut
